meanings.definition: Not receiving payment for work or services.
meanings.sent1: She felt disappointed when she realized the job was uncompensated.
meanings.sent2: The volunteer work was uncompensated but fulfilling.
meanings.sent3: The uncompensated task left her with a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent4: His uncompensated efforts spoke volumes about his dedication.
meanings.sent5: The uncompensated work was a labor of love for her.

meanings.definition: Not offset or balanced by anything else.
meanings.sent1: The uncompensated weight on one side caused the scale to tip.
meanings.sent2: The uncompensated expenses led to financial difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The uncompensated load made the truck struggle up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The uncompensated pressure was too much for the fragile structure.
meanings.sent5: The uncompensated force pushed the door open with a bang.

meanings.definition: Not made up for or corrected.
meanings.sent1: The uncompensated mistake in the report went unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: Her uncompensated absence was felt during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The uncompensated error caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The uncompensated oversight led to a delay in the project.
meanings.sent5: The uncompensated flaw in the design became apparent during testing.
